page.title: 04Landscape _ Leck area
page.content: Our landscape is generally hilly. The highest part of our block is High Gale which is 97 metres above sea level.The lowest part in our block is just outside Whittington which is 39 metres above sea level.Just outside our block to the east it climbs up rapidly to a height of 500 metres above sea level. The settlements in our block are on reasonably flat land because they are closeto rivers.Whittington is on the river Lune.Cowan Bridge,Leck, Overtown,and Burrow are on Leck Beck which joins the Lune at Burrow. The fell land is used for rough grazing of sheep and cattle and also for shooting. The lower land is still unsuitable for arable farming so it is mostly grazing land with just hay or silage being grown to feed livestock in winter.
